p: During the past 14 years, we observed large annual variability in timing of snowmelt, with the mean date of 20% snow cover ranging from the 28 May to 16 June (Figure 2). Despite this large interannual variability, we detected a significant negative relationship between year and date of 20% snow cover ( F 1,63 = 26.44; p < .001), with models predicting the date of 20% snow cover occurring 11 days earlier in 2016 as compared to 2003 (advancement rate of 0.8 days/year; Figure 2).
